ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: This is an extremely fast implementation of a Naive Bayes classifier. This package is currently the only package that supports a Bernoulli distribution, a Multinomial distribution, and a Gaussian distribution, making it suitable for both binary features, frequency counts, and numerical features. Another feature is the support of a mix of different event models. Only numerical variables are allowed, however, categorical variables can be transformed into dummies and used with the Bernoulli distribution. The implementation is largely based on the paper "A comparison of event models for Naive Bayes anti-spam e-mail filtering" written by K.M. Schneider (2003) <doi:10.3115/1067807.1067848>. Any issues can be submitted to: <https://github.com/mskogholt/fastNaiveBayes/issues>.

This is an extremely fast implementation of a Naive Bayes classifier. This package is currently the only package that supports a Bernoulli distribution, a Multinomial distribution, and a Gaussian distribution, making it suitable for both binary features, frequency counts, and numerical features. Another feature is the support of a mix of different event models. Only numerical variables are allowed, however, categorical variables can be transformed into dummies and used with the Bernoulli distribution. The implementation is largely based on the paper "A comparison of event models for Naive Bayes anti-spam e-mail filtering" written by K.M. Schneider (2003) <doi:10.3115/1067807.1067848>. Any issues can be submitted to: <https://github.com/mskogholt/fastNaiveBayes/issues>.

name: r-fastnaivebayes
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '2.2.1' %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-fastnaivebayes
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/fastNaiveBayes_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/fastNaiveBayes/fastNaiveBayes_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 36283929170c8053ba0bad0976f60ba3b07ae1512eaedfa35e3b58059b241b12

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic

  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

# Suggests: knitr, rmarkdown, testthat
requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]

  host:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-matrix

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('fastNaiveBayes')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('fastNaiveBayes')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/mskogholt/fastNaiveBayes

  license: GPL-3.0-only
  summary: 'This is an extremely fast implementation of a Naive Bayes classifier. This package
    is currently the only package that supports a Bernoulli distribution, a Multinomial
    distribution, and a Gaussian distribution, making it suitable for both binary features,
    frequency counts, and numerical features. Another feature is the support of a mix
    of different event models. Only numerical variables are allowed, however, categorical
    variables can be transformed into dummies and used with the Bernoulli distribution.
    The implementation is largely based on the paper "A comparison of event models for
    Naive Bayes anti-spam e-mail filtering" written by K.M. Schneider (2003) <doi:10.3115/1067807.1067848>.
    Any issues can be submitted to: <https://github.com/mskogholt/fastNaiveBayes/issues>.'

  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
